item.title: How AI Will Serve Us in the Workplace
item.description:
How AI Will Serve Us in the Workplace

We're on the brink of a new industrial revolution. The plummeting cost of computing power coupled with the rising commodification of machine learning is ushering in a new age of artificial intelligence (AI) in business.

item.title: What will artificial intelligence mean for the world of work?
item.description:
What will artificial intelligence mean for the world of work?

What can scientists tell us about business? I had an opportunity to consider this important question when, earlier this year, I led a debate with four professors from the University of California, Berkeley, who were experts in artificial intelligence, neuroscience and psychology.

item.title: Who's in charge of AI in the enterprise?
item.description:
Who's in charge of AI in the enterprise?

Artificial intelligence (AI) is starting to disrupt the workplace as applications powered by machine-learning algorithms begin to permeate enterprises at every level. Just who's doing that disrupting - and to whom do they report? Data scientists, business architects and quantitative analysts (also known as quants) are most often the professionals exploiting the burgeoning technology - sometimes under the mantel of the IT department, but often not.

item.title: Jerry Kaplan: "Humans Need Not Apply" | Talks at Google
item.description:
Jerry Kaplan: "Humans Need Not Apply" | Talks at Google

The common wisdom about Artificial Intelligence is that we are building increasingly intelligent machines that will ultimately surpass human capabilities, steal our jobs, possibly even escape human control and take over the world. Jerry Kaplan, author of Humans Need Not Apply: A Guide to Wealth and Work in the age of Artificial intelligence, share with us why his narrative is both misguided and counterproductive.

item.title: Humans Need Not Apply: A Guide to Wealth and Work in the Age of Artificial Intelligence, by Jerry Kaplan
item.description:
Humans Need Not Apply: A Guide to Wealth and Work in the Age of Artificial Intelligence, by Jerry Kaplan

As a science-fiction writer, I am happy to admit that artificial intelligence regularly gets a bad press in the more popular tales of the future.

item.title: Machines for thinking
item.description:
Machines for thinking

Machines of Loving Grace: The Quest for Common Ground Between Humans and Robots. By John Markoff. Ecco; 400 pages; $26.99. The Master Algorithm: How the Quest for the Ultimate Learning Machine Will Remake Our World. By Pedro Domingos. Basic Books; 352 pages; $29.99. Allen Lane; Â£20.

item.title: Will artificial intelligence overtake humans in the workplace?
item.description:
Will artificial intelligence overtake humans in the workplace?

Earlier this year, there were reports on advances in artificial intelligence. Stephen Hawking, Elon Musk and others voiced their concerns about computers overtaking humans, and it could start in the workplace, CBS News' Anthony Mason reports.

item.title: There's Hope For Artificial Intelligence in the Workplace - Artificial Intelligence Online
item.description:
There's Hope For Artificial Intelligence in the Workplace - Artificial Intelligence Online

Technology is often described as an enabler, but technology trends and concepts can also shape how we view the world. Depending on your point of view, you might see the workplace as a complicated human-powered machine that needs to be maintained for peak performance. Or you might think of it as an organism that needs ...

item.title: AI will transform 'massive swaths' of the workplace, LinkedIn's co-founder says
item.description:
AI will transform 'massive swaths' of the workplace, LinkedIn's co-founder says

Artificial intelligence is going to transform "massive swaths" of the workplace, LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman said Thursday. And its effects will be felt beyond sectors like manufacturing and energy, reaching into professional spheres like doctors, lawyers and financial analysts, he said. "It could have very positive effects, but it has very dynamic effects.

item.title: From Science Fiction to Reality: The Evolution of Artificial Intelligence
item.description:
From Science Fiction to Reality: The Evolution of Artificial Intelligence

What was once just a figment of the imagination of some our most famous science fiction writers, artificial intelligence (AI) is taking root in our everyday lives. We're still a few years away from having robots at our beck and call, but AI has already had a profound impact in more subtle ways.
